bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, May 16, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: ACKNOWLEDGED file JUNE 29 1901 Bureau of Foreign Commerce

div1.p: No. 70. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, May 16, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Increased facilities of transportation between Liverpool and Monrovia.
Synopsis. The British and African Steam Navigation Co; and the African Steamship Company, have so amended their schedules as to give Monrovia seven Steamers per month; each being mail from Liverpool.
No. 70. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; May 16, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence that the West African trade has so increased in volume, coupled with the prospect of the South African trade as to induce The Elder, Dumpster Co. of Liverpool, to run seven steamers to Monrovia monthly, each being mail matter, and four calling only for the mails and Kroo Bays. I have the honor to be yours &c &c. Owen L. W. Smith, C. G. Inclosures, Schedules.

TOURIST'S TICKETS, SALOON (available for Twelve Months) are issued from LIVERPOOL to MADEIRA TENERIFFE, and GRAND CANARY, for £15, giving Tourists the privilege of visiting these Islands, with the option of returning from GRAND CANARY to GENOA or BAROELONA by the magnificent steamers of LA VELOCE NAVIGAZIONE ITALIANA A VAPORE.
Madeira, Teneriffe, Grand Canary, & the West and South-West Coasts of Africa. THE AFRICAN STEAMSHIP COMPANY.
INCORPORATED BY ROYAL CHARTER. (UNDER CONTRACT FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF HER MAJESTY'S MAILS.) LOADING BERTH, SOUTH WEST SIDE BRUNSWICK DOCK.

NIGERIA (Building). . . . . . . . .5200 Tons. SEKONDI. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .5000 Tons. CAPT. H. G. HARRISON. FANTEE. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .5000 Tons. CAPT. HAMPSON. Shippers are respectfully informed that the Royal Mail Steamships will be despatched from Liverpool as under-- (Unless prevented by unforeseen circumstances.)
SAILING DATE. NAME. PORTS Last day for receiving cargo, if not previously full. Tender leaves Prince's Landing Stage.

May 4th NIGER {Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Goree, Dakar, Rufisque, Bathurst, Sierra Leone, Monrovia, Grand Bassa, Kroo Coast, Half Jack, Grand Bassam, Assinie, Half Assinie, Axim, Cape Coast Castle, Accra, *Lagos Roads, Bonny, New Calabar, Opobo.} 6 p.m., May 2nd 10 a.m., May 4th May 9th BENIN {Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Isles de Los, *Sierra Leone, Sherbro, Cape Mount, Monrovia, Grand Bassa, Cape Palmas, Sinoe, Kroo Coast, Half Jack, Lahou, Axim, Dixcove, Sekondi, Chama, Elmina, Anamaboe, Appam, Winnebah, *Accra, Pram Pram, Little Popo, Grand Popo, and Bey Beach.} 6p.m., May 7th 10a.m., May 9th May 25thANGOLA{Madeira, Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Isles de Los, Sierra Leone, Kroo Coast, Sekondi, Cape Coast Castle, Salt Pond, Accra, Addah, Quittah, Kotoneu, *Lagos Roads, Forcados, Benin, Sepelli, Warree, Burutu, Akassa and Brass.} 6 p.m., May 23rd 10 a.m., May 25th *WITH MAILS AND PASSENGERS ONLY.

WITH LIBERTY TO OALL AT THE ABOVE PORTS, IN ANY ORDER, BACKWARDS & FORWARDS, FOR ANY PURPOSE, ALSO AT ANY ADDITIONAL PORTS Parcels not exceeding 19 inches in measurement will be received in Liverpool up to 12 noon on the day previous to Sailing. The attention of Shippers is called to the following Conditions upon which Goods are received:--

No Bills of Lading will be signed except those on the form adopted by the Company, which states the Condition and Terms upon which the Goods will be carried and which constitute the contract between the Shipper and the Company. Two unstamped copies required with each set, also a CONSUL'S COPY for MADEIRA, ST. THOMAS, PRINCIPE, LANDANA, CABENDA, MUCULLA, MUSSERA, AMBRIZETTE, KINSEMBO, AMBRIZ, and LOANDA, stating weight, value, origin and contents.
Bills of Lading for TENERIFF'E and GRAND CANARY require to state the weight of Goods in Kilogrammes, and also the value and contents.

All Goods sent down for shipment must be accompanied by a Shipping Note on the Company's Form, specifying the contents, marks, numbers, and destination, and no parcels will be received unless accompanied by a declaration as to their contents.
All packages must be distinctly marked and numbered, and the destination painted thereon in letters not less than two inches in length.

Goods of a dangerous nature can only be taken under a special agreement, and parties Shipping any such Goods without such an agreement will be held liable for all consequences arising therefrom. Special attention is directed to the 446th Section of the Merchant Shipping Act of 1894, which is as follows:--

DANGEROUS GOODS.-- (1.) "A person shall not send or attempt to send by any vessel, British or Foreign, and a person not being the master or owner of the vessel, shall not carry or attempt to carry in any such vessel, any dangerous goods, without distinctly marking their nature on the outside of the package containing the same, and giving written notice of the nature of those goods and the name and address of the sender or carrier thereof to the master or owner of the vessel at or before the time of sending the same to be shipped or taking the same on board the vessel." (2.) "If any person fails, without reasonable cause, to comply with this section, he shall for each offence be liable to a fine not exceeding one hundred pounds; or if he shows that he was merely an agent in the shipment of any such goods as aforesaid, and was not aware and did not suspect and had no reason to suspect that the goods shipped by him were of a dangerous nature, then not exceeding ten pounds." (3.) "For the purpose of this part of this Act, the expression "dangerous goods" means aquafortis, vitriol, naphtha, benzine, gunpowder, lucifer matches, nitro glycerine, petroleum, any explosives within the meaning of the Explosives Act, 1875, and any other goods which are of a dangerous nature."

Goods for Lagos, Benin and Sapelli are intended to be transhipped to branch Steamers and conveyed to destination at Ship's expense but Shipper's risk : but liberty is reserved to deliver direct, without transhipment, if circumstances will allow.

Goods for Bathurst to be landed and put into Custom House store at Ship's expense, but all operations of landing and storing are at Shipper's risk. Goods for Sierra Leone will be landed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Goree, Dakar and Rufisque, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Sekondi, lighterage perfromed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Canary and Teneriffe, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for ports between Batanga and Loanda, both inclusive, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Fernando Po, Rio del Rey, Victoria and Bibunda, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk.

Any goods discharged into Company's craft or hulks either pending transhipment or at their port of destination, are, while in the craft, or hulk. at the Shipper's, Owner's or Consignee's risk in every respect, and the Company shall not be answerable for any loss or injury howsoever arising thereto or for delay in delivery. AND FURTHER, in the event of such goods remaining in the hulk or craft at the place of destination beyond seven days, the shippers or consignees shall pay for the privilege according to the Company's tariff.

In all cases the Ship's responsibility to cease when the Goods have left the Ship's deck, and that whether Bill of Lading be exchanged or not, Bills of Lading according to the Company's form are to be had of the LIVERPOOL PRINTING & STATIONARY CO., Limited 38, Castle Street, Liverpool.
FREIGHT MUST BE PREPAID. ALL LETTERS MUST PASS THROUGH THE POST-OFFICE.

For further information apply in ROTTERDAM, to P. A. VAN ES & Co.; in ANTWERP, to JOHN P. BEST & Co. and WALFORD & Co.; in PLYMOUTH, to H. J. WARING & Co., the Wharf Millbay ; in HAMBURG, to ELDER, DEMPSTER & CO., to ELDER, DEMPSTER & CO., Leadenhall Chambers, 4, St. Mary Axe, E.C.; and in LIVERPOOL, to
African House, Water Street, Liverpool, April, 1901
ELDER, DEMPSTER & CO., MANAGERS.

N. B. -- In the event of the Consuls Copy Bill of Lading, and the particulars of parcels required for making out the Consular Manifests not being handed in to this office before 1 p.m. on the day previous to sailing the Steamer will be cleared without them, and the Shippers will be held liable for all Fines and expenses that may be incurred through the above-mentioned documents and particulars not being furnished within the aforesaid time.
SPECIE for shipment by Saturdays' Steamers will be received on board at 3 p.m. on Friday, and at 3 p.m. on Tuesdays for Wednesdays' Steamers, and at 3 p.m. on Wednesday for Thursdays' Steamers.
N. B. -- CLOSING FOR CARGO TWO DAYS PREVIOUS TO SAILINGS.

Goods should be forwarded by the L. & N. W. Rail to Wapping Station; by the Midland, Great Central, Great Northern or Great Eastern to Brunswick Station; by the Gt. Western to Duke's Dock, or by L. & Y. to the South Dooks Station.
The British & African Steam Navigation Co. (1900), LIMITED.

F. M. GIBSON. TENERIFFE ... ... 2200 Tons. CAPT. W. E. POTTER. MADEIRA ... ... ... 2200 Tons. CAPT. NORRIS. ROQUELLE ... ... 2500 Tons. CAPT. E. J. HUGHES. LAGOS ... ... ... ... 2000 Tons. CAPT. W. JONES. SHERBRO ... ... .. 1800 Tons. CAPT. ANDERSON. BENGUELA ... ... 1860 Tons. CAPT. HARPER.
Under Contract with the Postmaster-General for Conveyance of His Majesty's Mails between Liverpool and the West and South-West Coasts of Africa.
LOADING BERTH, SOUTH-WEST SIDE BRUNSWICK DOCK.
The following or other ROYAL MAIL STEAMERS are intended to be despatched as undernoted:--
Date to Sail. Steamer. For If Steamer not previously full Goods will be Received until Parcels will be Received at the Office until Passengers embark by Tender from Prince's Landing Stage at

Wed. May 1. BORNU{*Monrovia, *Axim, *Sekondl, *Cape Coast Castle, *Accra, *Lagos Roads, Fernandos, Burutu, *Bonny and Old Calabar.}6 p.m. Apl. 29 12 noon Apl. 3010 a.m. May 1 Wed. May 8VOLTA{*Monrovia, *Axim, *Sekondi, *Cape Coast Castle, *Accra, *Lagos Roads, Fernando Po, Rio del dey Rey, Victoria, Cameroons, Batanga, Bata, Botica, Gaboon, Ukaka, Cape Lopez, Setta Camma, Nyanga Mayumba, Loango, Landana, Cabenda, Congo, Banana, Noqui, Boma, Matadi, Mueulla, Ambrizette, Mussera, Kinsembo, Ambriz, Loanda.}6 p.m. May 612 noon May 710 a.m. May 8 Wed. May 11BONNY{Madeira, Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Isles de Los, Sierra Leone, Kroo Coast, Sekondi, Cape Coast Castle, Salt Pond, Accra, Addah, Quittah, Kotonou, *Lagos Roads, Forcados, Benin, Sapelli, Warree, Burutu, Akassa, and Brass.} 6 p.m. May 912 noon May 1010 a.m. May 11 Wed. May 15OLENDA{*Monrovia, *Axim, *Sekondi, *Cape Coast Castle, *Accra, Lagos Roads, Forcados, Burutu, Bonny, and Old Calabar.}6 p.m. May 1312 noon May 1410 a.m. May 15 Sat. May 18BOMA{Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Goree, Dakar, Ruflsque, Bathurst, Sierra Leone, Monrovia, Grand Bassa, Kroo Coast, Half Jack, Grand Bassam, Assinie, Half Assinie, Axim, Cape Coast Castle, Accra, *Lagos Roads, Bonny, New Calabar and Opobo.}6 p.m. May 1612 noon May 1710a.m. May 18 Wed. May 29SOKOTO{*Monrovia, *Axim, *Sekondi, *Cape Coast Castle, *Accra, Lagos Roads, Forcados, Burutu, *Bonny and Old Calabar.}6 p.m. May 2712 noon May 2810 a.m. May 29 Thur. May 30BENGUELA.Grand Canary, Teneriffe, Isles de Los, *Sierra Leone, Sherbo, Cape Mount, Monrovia, Grand Bassa, Cape Palmas, Sinoe, Kroo Coast, Half Jack, Lahou, Axim, Dixcove, Sekondi, Chama, Eimina, Anamaboe, Appam, Winnebah, *Accra, Pram Pram, Little Popo, Grand Popo, and Bey Beach. 6 p.m. May 2812 noon May 2910 a.m. May 30 *WITH MAILS AND PASSENGERS ONLY.

With liberty to call at above Ports, in any order, backwards and forwards, for any purpose also at any additional Ports. First Class Tourist Tickets, available for 12 months, are now issued from Liverpool to Madeira, Teneriffe, and Grand Canary, at £15 each, with option of returning from Grand Canary to Genoa or Carcelona by the magnificent Steamers of La Veloce Navigatione Italiana a vapore.

The attention of Shippers is called to the following Conditions upon which Goods are received:-- No Bills of Lading will be signed except those on the form adopted by the Company, which state the Conditions and Terms upon which the Goods will be carried, and which constitute the contract between the SHipper and the COmpany. Two unstamped copies required with each set, also a CONSUL'S COPY for MADEIRA, ST. THOMAS, PRINCIPE, LANDANA, CABENDA, MUCULLA, MUSSERA, AMBRIZETTE, KINSEMBO, AMBRIZ, and LOANDA, stating weight, value, origin, and contents.

All Goods sent down for shipment must be accompanied by a Shipping Note on the Company's Form, specifying the contents, marks, numbers, and destination, and no parcels will be received unless accompanied by a declaration as to their contents.

All Packages must be distinctly marked and numbered, and the destination painted thereon in letters not less than two inches in length. Goods of a dangerous nature can only be taken under a special agreement, and parties Shipping any such Goods without such an agreement will be held liable for all consequences arising therefrom. Special attention is directed to the Section 446 of the Merchant Shipping Act of 1894, which is as follows:-- DANGEROUS GOODS: (1.) A person shall not send or attempt to send by any vessel, British or Foreign, and a person not being the master or owner of the vessel, shall not carry or attempt to carry in any such vessel, any dangerous goods, without distinctly marking their nature on the outside of the package containing the same, and giving written notice of the nature of those goods and of the name and address of the sender or carrier thereof to the master or owner of the vessel at or before the time of sending the same to be shipped or taking the same on board the vessel. (2.) If any person fails without reasonable cause to comply with this section, he shall for each offence be liable to a fine not exceeding one hundred pounds; or if he shows that he was merely an agent in the shipment of any such goods as aforesaid, and was not aware and did not suspect and had no reason to suspect that the goods shipped by him were of a dangerous nature, then not exceeding ten pounds. (3.) For the purpose of this part of this Act the expression "dangerous goods" means Aquafortis, Vitriol, Naphtha, Benzine, Gunpowder, Lucifer Matches, Nitro-Glycerine, Petroleum, and Explosives within the meaning of the Explosives Act, 1875, and any other goods which are of a dangerous nature.

Goods for Lagos, Benin and Sapelli, are intended to be transhipped to branch Steamers and conveyed to destination at Ship's expense but Shipper's risk; but liberty is reserved to deliver direct, without transhipment if circumstances will allow. Goods for Bathurst to be landed and put into Custom House store at Ship's expense, but all operations of landing and storing are at Shipper's risk. Goods for Sierra Leone will be landed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Goree, Dakar and Ruflsque, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Sekondi, lighterage performed at Ship;s expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Canary and Teneriffe, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for ports between Batanga and Londa, both inclusive, lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk. Goods for Fernando Po, Rio del Rey, Victoria, and Bibundi lighterage performed at Ship's expense, but Shipper's risk.

Any goods discharged into Company's craft or hulks, either pending transhipment or at their port of destination, are, while in the craft or hulk, at the Shipper's, Owners or Consignee's risk in every respect and the Company shall not be answerable for any loss or injury however arising thereto or for delay in delivery. AND FURTHER, in the event of such goods remaining in the hulk or craft at the place of destination beyond seven days, the shippers or consignees shall pay for the privilege according to the Company's tariff.
In all cases the ship's responsibility to cease when the Goods have left the ship's deck, and that whether Bill of Lading be exchanged or not.

Bills of Lading of the Company's Form can be obtained from TURNER & DUNNETT, 19, Fenwick Street, Liverpool: MAWDSLEY & SONS, 4 & 6, Castle Street, Liverpool; and the Liverpool Printing and Stationery Co., 38, Castle Street, Liverpool.

FREIGHT MUST IN ALL CASES BE PREPAID. Specie received on board the Steamers at 3 o'clock p.m. on Fridays for Saturday's steamers, and 3 p/m. on Tuesdays for Wednesday's steamers, and Wednesday for Thursday's steamers. All Letters must pass through the Post Office.

For further information apply in London, to ELDER, DEMPSTER & Co., Leadenhall Chambers, 4, St. Mary Axe; in Manchester to Elder, Dempster & Co., 8, Commercial Buildings, Cross Street; in Hamburg to ELDER, DEMPSTER & Co., Luisenhof, Neuegroninger Strasse, 4; in Antwerp to JOHN P. BEST & Co., or WALFORD & Co; in Rotterdam to P. A. VAN Es & Co.; in Glasgow, at the Company's Office, 175, West George Street; and in Liverpool to APRIL, 1901. ELDER, DEMPSTER & CO., AFRICAN HOUSE, WATER STREET.

N. B. In the event of the Consul's Copy Bill of Lading not being handed in to this office before 1 p.m. on the day previous to sailing, and the particulars of parcels required for making out the Consular Manifests, the Steamer will be cleared without them, and the shippers will be held liable for all. Fines and Expenses that may be incurred through the above-mentioned documents and particulars not being furnished within the aforesaid times.
Closing Days, Thursdays for Saturdays' Steamers. Mondays for Wednesdays

Goods should be forwarded by the L & N. W. Rail. to Wapping Station; by the Midland, Great Central, Great Northern or Great Eastern to Brunswick Station; by the Gt. Western to Duke's Dock, or by L. & Y. to the South Docks Station.
